channel.title: faculty on Division of Formal Methods
channel.description: Recent content in faculty on Division of Formal Methods

item.title: Laura Kov√°cs
item.description: Laura Kovacs: Professor Research area: My research is on formal software analysis and verification. More specifically, I am interested in designing new methods for computer-aided verification by combining: automated theorem proving, automated assertion generation, symbolic computation. [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/k/Kov=aacute=cs:Laura][dblp link]] [[http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~laurako/][personal page]] related projects: [[https://vprover.github.io][Vampire: resolution-based automatic theorem prover]]

item.title: Nir Piterman
item.description: Nir Piterman: Professor Research area: My research interests include formal verification and automata theory. I have worked (and still am) on model checking of various types of systems, different aspects of temporal logic, as well as synthesis and game solving. I am also working on applications of formal methods to biological modeling. [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/p/Piterman:Nir][dblp link]] TODO [[https://www.cs.le.ac.uk/people/npiterman/][personal page]] related projects: TODO [[https://www.cs.le.ac.uk/people/npiterman/][DSynMA: Distributed Synthesis from Single to Multiple Agents]]

item.title: Moa Johansson
item.description: Professor + Research area: learning and exploration in automated theorem proving, automated reasoning about recursive programs, reasoning for program analysis, automated discovery of inductive lemmas. + [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/j/Johansson:Moa][dblp link]] + [[http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~jomoa/][personal page]] + related projects: - [[http://hackage.haskell.org/package/quickspec][QuickSpec]] - [[https://github.com/danr/hipspec][HipSpec]]
